title: Inbox Watcher Notification Injection via tmux

comment:
QA Pre-Review: CR-058 v0.1 -- COMPLIANT. All review criteria verified with evidence as follows:

FRONTMATTER:
- title: 'Inbox Watcher Notification Injection via tmux' -- present, non-empty
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' -- appropriate for v0.1; CR ID not required (self-authorizing executable document per SOP-002 Section 8)

DOCUMENT STRUCTURE (per SOP-002 Section 6 / TEMPLATE-CR):
All 12 required sections present: (1) Purpose, (2) Scope with 2.1 Context / 2.2 Changes Summary / 2.3 Files Affected, (3) Current State, (4) Proposed State, (5) Change Description with subsections 5.1-5.4, (6) Justification, (7) Impact Assessment with 7.1-7.3, (8) Testing Summary, (9) Implementation Plan with phases 9.1-9.5, (10) Execution with EI table and Execution Comments, (11) Execution Summary, (12) References.

Sections 7.4 (Development Controls) and 7.5 (Qualified State Continuity) correctly omitted -- this CR modifies Docker infrastructure and agent definitions, not SDLC-governed controlled code.

PLACEHOLDER COMPLIANCE:
- No template placeholders found (all replaced)
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found
- Square bracket placeholders present only in execution sections (10, 11) -- correct for pre-execution phase

TRACEABILITY:
- Parent: CR-056-VAR-003 (verified PRE_APPROVED, Type 2 VAR) -- correctly referenced
- CR-056 (verified CLOSED) -- correctly referenced as originating CR
- SOP-001, SOP-002, SOP-004, CR-057 -- valid references

CONTENT QUALITY:
- Purpose clearly states the problem (notification injection gap) and origin (CR-056-VAR-003 EI-1)
- Current/Proposed State use present tense, declarative statements
- Change Description provides thorough technical detail including tmux architecture, send-keys mechanism, agent state handling table, and known limitations
- Justification addresses problem, impact of inaction, and solution rationale
- Testing Summary defines five specific, verifiable test cases (T1-T5)
- Implementation Plan has five sequential phases with clear steps
- EI table has five items mapping to the five implementation phases, conforming to SOP-004 Section 4.2

FORMATTING:
- Consistent heading hierarchy, horizontal rules, table formatting, code blocks
- No formatting inconsistencies found

TYPOS/ERRORS: None found.

RTM QUALIFIED BASELINE: N/A (not a controlled code CR).

REVIEWER ASSIGNMENT: No additional TUs assigned. This CR affects Docker infrastructure and agent definitions only; no Flow State application code domains are impacted.

Recommendation: PROCEED TO APPROVAL.

QA Post-Review: CR-058 v1.2 -- COMPLIANT. All post-execution review criteria verified with evidence per SOP-004 Section 10.

FRONTMATTER:
- title: 'Inbox Watcher Notification Injection via tmux' -- present, unchanged from pre-approved version
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' -- appropriate for executable document in execution phase

PRE-APPROVED CONTENT INTEGRITY:
Sections 1-9 verified identical to pre-approved v1.0 content. No unauthorized modifications.

EXECUTION ITEM COMPLETENESS (5/5):
- EI-1: Pass. Evidence: commit fd05d8e, docker/Dockerfile +1 line (tmux added to apt-get install)
- EI-2: Pass. Evidence: commit fd05d8e, launch.sh +2/-1 lines (tmux new-session integration)
- EI-3: Pass. Evidence: commit fd05d8e, inbox-watcher.py +84/-12 lines (send_notification refactored to inject_notification with tmux send-keys)
- EI-4: Pass. Evidence: commit fd05d8e, 6 agent files x +18 lines each (notification instructions added)
- EI-5: Pass. Evidence: T1-T5 test results documented with specific observations. Performed by lead (independent test executor).

COMMIT VERIFICATION:
Commit fd05d8e verified in git log. Commit message: 'CR-058 execution (EI-1 through EI-4): tmux notification injection for container agents'. File statistics align with claimed changes across all 9 affected files (Dockerfile, launch.sh, inbox-watcher.py, 6 agent definition files).

EVIDENCE QUALITY (per SOP-004 Section 8):
All Pass outcomes have documented evidence. Commit hash is verifiable. Test narratives describe specific observations for each test case.

FAIL OUTCOMES / VARs:
No Fail outcomes. No VARs filed. No blocking VARs to resolve.

SCOPE INTEGRITY (per SOP-004 Section 6):
All 5 pre-approved scope items addressed. No items dropped. No unauthorized scope additions.

EXECUTION SUMMARY (Section 11):
Complete. Summarizes all EI outcomes, references commit fd05d8e, notes T4 design clarification (Claude Code native queue vs tmux buffering -- better than designed, no code change needed). States no deviations and no VARs.

EXECUTION COMMENTS:
One comment documenting T4 observation. Factual, properly recorded with performer and date.

PLACEHOLDER COMPLIANCE:
No execution-phase placeholders remain. All [SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], [PERFORMER], [DATE], [COMMENT], and [EXECUTION_SUMMARY] replaced with actual values.

TYPOS/ERRORS: None found.
FORMATTING: Consistent throughout execution sections.

Recommendation: PROCEED TO POST-APPROVAL.
